name: fortinet-fortirecon-brand-protection
label: Fortinet FortiRecon Brand Protection
description: FortiRecon is a Digital Risk Protection Service (DRPS) product that provides an outside-the-network view to the risks posed to your enterprise.

fields.name: server_url
fields.title: Server URL
fields.description: Server name or IP address to which you will connect and perform the automated operations

fields.name: api_key
fields.title: API Key
fields.description: API key to access the endpoint to which you will connect and perform the automated operations

fields.name: org_id
fields.title: Organization ID
fields.description: The organization ID on which FortiRecon operations are to be performed.

fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set to True.

operations.title: Get Code Repo Exposures
operations.description: Retrieves a list of code repo exposures based on the filter criteria that you have specified.

parameters.name: q
parameters.title: Search By Keyword
parameters.tooltip: Specify a keyword to search in code repositories and retrieve results containing the specified keyword.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a keyword to search in code repositories and retrieve results containing the specified keyword.

parameters.name: matched_domain
parameters.title: Matched Domain
parameters.tooltip: Specify a domain to search in code repositories and retrieve results containing the specified domain name. You can specify multiple comma-separated domains to retrieve code repo exposures containing the specified domains. For example: domain1.com,domain2.com.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a domain to search in code repositories and retrieve results containing the specified domain name. You can specify multiple comma-separated domains to retrieve code repo exposures containing the specified domains. For example: domain1.com,domain2.com.

parameters.name: risk_level
parameters.title: Risk Level
parameters.tooltip: Specify a risk level to search in code repositories and retrieve results containing the specified risk level. You can specify multiple comma-separated risk levels to retrieve code repositories containing the specified risk levels. For example: LOW,MEDIUM,HIGH.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a risk level to search in code repositories and retrieve results containing the specified risk level. You can specify multiple comma-separated risk levels to retrieve code repositories containing the specified risk levels. For example: LOW,MEDIUM,HIGH.

parameters.name: attribute_type
parameters.title: Attribute Type
parameters.tooltip: Specify an attribute type to search in code repositories and retrieve results containing the specified attribute type. You can specify multiple comma-separated attribute types to retrieve code repositories containing the specified attribute types. For example: Email,Password.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify an attribute type to search in code repositories and retrieve results containing the specified attribute type. You can specify multiple comma-separated attribute types to retrieve code repositories containing the specified attribute types. For example: Email,Password.

parameters.name: status
parameters.title: Status
parameters.tooltip: Select a status to search in code repositories and retrieve results containing the specified status. You can select from the following options: Active Ignored Resolved
parameters.description: (Optional) Select a status to search in code repositories and retrieve results containing the specified status. You can select from the following options: Active Ignored Resolved

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.tooltip: Select the start date of the range containing the date when a profile was added. Selecting a start date is mandatory if an End Date is selected.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the start date of the range containing the date when a profile was added. Selecting a start date is mandatory if an End Date is selected.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.title: End Date
parameters.tooltip: Select the end date of the range containing the date when a profile was added. Default is the current date.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the end date of the range containing the date when a profile was added. Default is the current date.

parameters.name: page
parameters.title: Page
parameters.tooltip: Specify the page number from which to retrieve the results. Default value is 1.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the page number from which to retrieve the results. Default value is 1.

parameters.name: size
parameters.title: Size
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of records to fetch per page. Default value is 10 and you can specify a maximum value of 500 per page.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the number of records to fetch per page. Default value is 10 and you can specify a maximum value of 500 per page.

operations.title: Get Code Repositories
operations.description: Retrieves a list of code repositories based on the searched keyword, domain, risk level, and other filter criteria that you have specified.

parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a keyword to search in code repositories and retrieve results containing the specified keyword.

parameters.tooltip: Specify a domain to search in code repositories and retrieve results containing the specified domain name. You can specify multiple comma-separated domains to retrieve code repo exposures containing the specified domains. For example: domain1.com,domain2.com.

parameters.name: status

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.tooltip: Select the start date of the range containing the date when a profile was added. Selecting a start date is mandatory if an End Date is selected.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the start date of the range containing the date when a profile was added. Selecting a start date is mandatory if an End Date is selected.

parameters.name: end_date

parameters.name: page

parameters.name: size

parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of records to fetch per page. Default value is 10 and you can specify a maximum value of 500 per page.

operations.title: Get Code Repos Statistics
operations.description: Retrieves statistics for all code repositories associated with the Organization ID specified in configuration parameters.

operations.title: Get Code Repo Matched Domains Statistics
operations.description: Retrieves statistics of all matched domains associated with the Organization ID specified in configuration parameters.

operations.title: Get Domain Threats
operations.description: Retrieves list of code domain threats based on the filter criteria that you have specified.

parameters.name: q
parameters.title: Search By Keyword
parameters.tooltip: Specify a keyword to search in domain threats and retrieve results containing the specified keyword. The keyword is searched in domain, URL, severity, original domain, online status, and fuzzer fields.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a keyword to search in domain threats and retrieve results containing the specified keyword. The keyword is searched in domain, URL, severity, original domain, online status, and fuzzer fields.

parameters.name: original_domain
parameters.title: Original Domain
parameters.tooltip: Specify a domain to search in domain threats and retrieve results containing the specified domain name. You can specify multiple comma-separated domains to retrieve domain threats containing the specified domains. For example: domain1.com,domain2.com.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a domain to search in domain threats and retrieve results containing the specified domain name. You can specify multiple comma-separated domains to retrieve domain threats containing the specified domains. For example: domain1.com,domain2.com.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.title: Tags
parameters.tooltip: Specify a tag to search in domain threats and retrieve results containing the specified tags. You can specify multiple tags to retrieve domain threats containing the specified tags. For example: b7c4409f4e34eedc7a5447b077732c66,b7c4409f4e34eedc7a5447b077732c77. NOTE: Tag ID can be retrieved from the Get Tags action.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a tag to search in domain threats and retrieve results containing the specified tags. You can specify multiple tags to retrieve domain threats containing the specified tags. For example: b7c4409f4e34eedc7a5447b077732c66,b7c4409f4e34eedc7a5447b077732c77. NOTE: Tag ID can be retrieved from the Get Tags action.

parameters.name: online_status
parameters.title: Online Status
parameters.tooltip: Select an online status search in domain threats and retrieve results containing the specified online status. You can select one of the following options: Online Not Available Non Functional Offline
parameters.description: (Optional) Select an online status search in domain threats and retrieve results containing the specified online status. You can select one of the following options: Online Not Available Non Functional Offline

parameters.name: status
parameters.title: Status
parameters.tooltip: Select a status to search in domain threats and retrieve results containing the specified status. You can select from the following options: Active Ignored Resolved
parameters.description: (Optional) Select a status to search in domain threats and retrieve results containing the specified status. You can select from the following options: Active Ignored Resolved

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.tooltip: Select the start date of the range containing the date when a profile was added. Selecting a start date is mandatory if an End Date is selected.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the start date of the range containing the date when a profile was added. Selecting a start date is mandatory if an End Date is selected.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.title: End Date
parameters.tooltip: Select the end date of the range containing the date when a profile was added. Default is the current date.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the end date of the range containing the date when a profile was added. Default is the current date.

parameters.name: page
parameters.title: Page
parameters.tooltip: Specify the page number from which to retrieve the results. Default value is 1.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the page number from which to retrieve the results. Default value is 1.

parameters.name: size
parameters.title: Size
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of records to fetch per page. Default value is 10 and you can specify a maximum value of 500 per page.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the number of records to fetch per page. Default value is 10 and you can specify a maximum value of 500 per page.

operations.title: Get Domain Threats By ID
operations.description: Retrieves details of threats on a domain based on the threat ID that you have specified.

parameters.name: id
parameters.title: Domain Threat ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify an ID of the domain threat to retrieve its details.
parameters.description: Specify an ID of the domain threat to retrieve its details.

parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a source type in which to search and retrieve results containing the specified Executive ID.

operations.title: Get Open Bucket Exposures
operations.description: Retrieves list of open bucket exposures based on the filter criteria that you have specified.

parameters.name: q
parameters.title: Search By Keyword
parameters.tooltip: Specify a keyword to search in open bucket exposures and retrieve results containing the specified keyword.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a keyword to search in open bucket exposures and retrieve results containing the specified keyword.

parameters.name: file_type

parameters.tooltip: Specify a file type to search in open bucket exposures and retrieve results containing the specified file types. You can specify multiple comma-separated file types to retrieve open bucket exposures containing the specified file types. For example gz,tgz,docx.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a file type to search in open bucket exposures and retrieve results containing the specified file types. You can specify multiple comma-separated file types to retrieve open bucket exposures containing the specified file types. For example gz,tgz,docx.

parameters.name: bucket_type
parameters.title: Bucket Type
parameters.tooltip: Specify a bucket type to search in open bucket exposures and retrieve results containing the specified bucket types. You can specify multiple comma-separated bucket types to retrieve open bucket exposures containing the specified bucket types. For example gcp,aws,azure.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a bucket type to search in open bucket exposures and retrieve results containing the specified bucket types. You can specify multiple comma-separated bucket types to retrieve open bucket exposures containing the specified bucket types. For example gcp,aws,azure.

parameters.name: status
parameters.title: Status
parameters.tooltip: Select a status to search in open bucket exposures and retrieve results containing the specified status. You can select from the following options: Active Ignored Resolved
parameters.description: (Optional) Select a status to search in open bucket exposures and retrieve results containing the specified status. You can select from the following options: Active Ignored Resolved

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.tooltip: Select the start date of the range containing the date when a profile was added. Selecting a start date is mandatory if an End Date is selected.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the start date of the range containing the date when a profile was added. Selecting a start date is mandatory if an End Date is selected.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.title: End Date
parameters.tooltip: Select the end date of the range containing the date when a profile was added. Default is the current date.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the end date of the range containing the date when a profile was added. Default is the current date.

parameters.name: page

parameters.tooltip: Specify the page number from which to retrieve the results. Default value is 1.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the page number from which to retrieve the results. Default value is 1.

parameters.name: size
parameters.title: Size
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of records to fetch per page. Default value is 10 and you can specify a maximum value of 500 per page.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the number of records to fetch per page. Default value is 10 and you can specify a maximum value of 500 per page.

operations.title: Get Rogue Apps
operations.description: Retrieves a list of Rogue Apps based on the status and keywords that you have specified for the query; rogue apps are mobile applications trying to look like apps from trusted brands.

parameters.name: status
parameters.title: Status
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the rogue apps status type from the following options to filter the results: Unofficial: These are the apps that are not necessarily rouge but mention your organization's brand Official: These are the apps that are officially published by your organization Rogue: These are the apps that are deemed to be impersonating your organization Takedown: These are the rouge apps that are currently undergoing takedown by FortiRecon False Positive: These are the apps that were classified as either rouge or unofficial but are now deemed to be false positives by your organization's analysts Resolved: These are the rouge apps that have been taken down.
parameters.tooltip: Select the rogue apps status type from the following options to filter the results: Unofficial: These are the apps that are not necessarily rouge but mention your organization's brand Official: These are the apps that are officially published by your organization Rogue: These are the apps that are deemed to be impersonating your organization Takedown: These are the rouge apps that are currently undergoing takedown by FortiRecon False Positive: These are the apps that were classified as either rouge or unofficial but are now deemed to be false positives by your organization's analysts Resolved: These are the rouge apps that have been taken down.

parameters.name: q
parameters.title: Search By Keyword
parameters.tooltip: Specify the keywords to filter the results. Specified keyword is searched in these fields: Keyword, Source Name, Developer Name, App Name.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the keywords to filter the results. Specified keyword is searched in these fields: Keyword, Source Name, Developer Name, App Name.

parameters.name: appstore
parameters.title: App Store Name
parameters.tooltip: Specify an app store in which to search for rogue apps and retrieve results. You can specify multiple comma-separated file types to retrieve rogue apps containing the specified file types. For example: Androidapk,Applestore.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify an app store in which to search for rogue apps and retrieve results. You can specify multiple comma-separated file types to retrieve rogue apps containing the specified file types. For example: Androidapk,Applestore.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.tooltip: Select the start date of the range containing the date when the rogue app was first seen. Selecting a start date is mandatory if an End Date is selected.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the start date of the range containing the date when the rogue app was first seen. Selecting a start date is mandatory if an End Date is selected.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.title: End Date
parameters.tooltip: Select the end date of the range containing the date when a rogue app was first seen. Default is the current date.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the end date of the range containing the date when a rogue app was first seen. Default is the current date.

parameters.name: page
parameters.title: Page
parameters.tooltip: Specify the page number from which to retrieve the results. Default value is 1.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the page number from which to retrieve the results. Default value is 1.

parameters.name: size
parameters.title: Size
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of records to fetch per page. Default value is 10 and you can specify a maximum value of 500 per page.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the number of records to fetch per page. Default value is 10 and you can specify a maximum value of 500 per page.

operations.title: Get Rogue App By ID
operations.description: Retrieves details of a rogue app based on the Rogue App ID that you have specified.

parameters.name: id
parameters.title: Rogue App ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the rogue app to get its details.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the rogue app to get its details.

operations.title: Get Social Media Threats
operations.description: Retrieves list of social media threats based on the filter criteria that you have specified.

parameters.name: q
parameters.title: Search By Keyword
parameters.tooltip: Specify a keyword to search in social media threats and retrieve results containing the specified keyword in profile name or handle name fields.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a keyword to search in social media threats and retrieve results containing the specified keyword in profile name or handle name fields.

parameters.name: media_type
parameters.title: Media Type
parameters.tooltip: Specify a social media platform to search in social media threats and retrieve results containing the specified social media platforms. You can specify multiple comma-separated social media platforms to retrieve social media threats containing the specified social media platforms. For example FACEBOOK,INSTAGRAM,TWITTER.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a social media platform to search in social media threats and retrieve results containing the specified social media platforms. You can specify multiple comma-separated social media platforms to retrieve social media threats containing the specified social media platforms. For example FACEBOOK,INSTAGRAM,TWITTER.

parameters.name: profile_name
parameters.title: Profile Name
parameters.tooltip: Specify a profile name to search and retrieve social media threats containing the specified profile name.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a profile name to search and retrieve social media threats containing the specified profile name.

parameters.name: handle_name
parameters.title: Handle Name
parameters.tooltip: Specify a handle name to search and retrieve social media threats containing the specified handle name.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a handle name to search and retrieve social media threats containing the specified handle name.

parameters.name: is_verified
parameters.title: Is Verified
parameters.tooltip: Select whether the profile or the handle name is verified to retrieve social media threats containing only verified profile or handle name. You can select one of the following options: True False
parameters.description: (Optional) Select whether the profile or the handle name is verified to retrieve social media threats containing only verified profile or handle name. You can select one of the following options: True False

parameters.name: status
parameters.title: Status
parameters.tooltip: Select a status to search in social media threats and retrieve results containing the specified status. You can select from the following options: Active False Positive Takedown Resolved
parameters.description: (Optional) Select a status to search in social media threats and retrieve results containing the specified status. You can select from the following options: Active False Positive Takedown Resolved

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.tooltip: Select the start date of the range containing the date when a profile was added. Selecting a start date is mandatory if an End Date is selected.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the start date of the range containing the date when a profile was added. Selecting a start date is mandatory if an End Date is selected.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.title: End Date
parameters.tooltip: Select the end date of the range containing the date when a profile was added. Default is the current date.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the end date of the range containing the date when a profile was added. Default is the current date.

parameters.name: page
parameters.title: Page
parameters.tooltip: Specify the page number from which to retrieve the results. Default value is 1.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the page number from which to retrieve the results. Default value is 1.

parameters.name: size
parameters.title: Size
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of records to fetch per page. Default value is 10 and you can specify a maximum value of 500 per page.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the number of records to fetch per page. Default value is 10 and you can specify a maximum value of 500 per page.

operations.title: Get Domain Threats Statistics
operations.description: Retrieves statistics for domain threats.

operations.title: Get Original Domains Statistics
operations.description: Retrieves the statistics of original domains threats based on the page number and the page size specified.

operations.title: Get Open Bucket Exposures Statistics
operations.description: Retrieves the statistics of open bucket exposures.

operations.title: Get Social Media Threats Statistics
operations.description: Retrieves the statistics of social media threats.

operations.title: Get Tags
operations.description: Retrieves the list of active tags.

operations.title: Get Takedown Requests
operations.description: Retrieves a list of takedown requests for rogue apps and typo domains for the given organization the filter criteria that you have specified.

parameters.name: q
parameters.title: Search By Keyword
parameters.tooltip: Specify a keyword to search in take-down requests and retrieve results containing the specified keyword in ticket Id or entity fields. The entity field may contain domain name, title of a report, or Phished Domain.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a keyword to search in take-down requests and retrieve results containing the specified keyword in ticket Id or entity fields. The entity field may contain domain name, title of a report, or Phished Domain.

parameters.name: status
parameters.title: Status
parameters.tooltip: Select a status to search in take-down requests and retrieve results containing the specified status. You can select from the following options: Requested Acknowledged Rejected Approved Initiated Successfully Closed Unsuccessfully Closed
parameters.description: (Optional) Select a status to search in take-down requests and retrieve results containing the specified status. You can select from the following options: Requested Acknowledged Rejected Approved Initiated Successfully Closed Unsuccessfully Closed

parameters.name: category
parameters.title: Category
parameters.tooltip: Select a category to search in take-down requests and retrieve results containing the specified category. you can select from the following options: DomainThreat RogueApps SocialMediaThreat
parameters.description: (Optional) Select a category to search in take-down requests and retrieve results containing the specified category. you can select from the following options: DomainThreat RogueApps SocialMediaThreat

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.tooltip: Select the start date of the range containing the date when the takedown was requested. Selecting a start date is mandatory if an End Date is selected.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the start date of the range containing the date when the takedown was requested. Selecting a start date is mandatory if an End Date is selected.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.title: End Date
parameters.tooltip: Select the end date of the range containing the date when the takedown was requested. Default is the current date.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the end date of the range containing the date when the takedown was requested. Default is the current date.

parameters.name: page
parameters.title: Page
parameters.tooltip: Specify the page number from which to retrieve the results. Default value is 1.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the page number from which to retrieve the results. Default value is 1.

parameters.name: size
parameters.title: Size
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of records to fetch per page. Default value is 10 and you can specify a maximum value of 500 per page.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the number of records to fetch per page. Default value is 10 and you can specify a maximum value of 500 per page.

operations.title: Update Code Repo Status
operations.description: Updates the status of the Code Repo based on the code repo ID and the status to update.

parameters.name: repo_id
parameters.title: Code Repo ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the code repo whose status to update on Fortinet FortiRecon Brand Protection.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the code repo whose status to update on Fortinet FortiRecon Brand Protection.

parameters.title: Status
parameters.name: status
parameters.tooltip: Specify the status to update on Fortinet FortiRecon Brand Protection. You can choose from the following options: Active Resolved Ignored
parameters.description: Specify the status to update on Fortinet FortiRecon Brand Protection. You can choose from the following options: Active Resolved Ignored

operations.title: Update Domain Threat Status
operations.description: Updates the status of the Domain Threat record based on the Domain Threat ID and the status to update.

parameters.name: domain_threat_id
parameters.title: Domain Threat ID
parameters.description: Specify the threat ID of the domain whose status to update on Fortinet FortiRecon Brand Protection.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the threat ID of the domain whose status to update on Fortinet FortiRecon Brand Protection.

parameters.title: Status
parameters.name: status
parameters.tooltip: Specify the status to update on Fortinet FortiRecon Brand Protection. You can choose from the following options: Active Resolved False Positive Takedown Safelist
parameters.description: Specify the status to update on Fortinet FortiRecon Brand Protection. You can choose from the following options: Active Resolved False Positive Takedown Safelist

operations.title: Update Open Bucket Exposure Status
operations.description: Updates the status of the Open Bucket Exposure record based on the Open Bucket Exposure ID and the status to update.

parameters.name: open_bucket_exposure_id
parameters.title: Open Bucket Exposure ID
parameters.description: Specify the exposure ID of the open bucket whose status to update on Fortinet FortiRecon Brand Protection.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the exposure ID of the open bucket whose status to update on Fortinet FortiRecon Brand Protection.

parameters.title: Status
parameters.name: status
parameters.tooltip: Specify the status to update on Fortinet FortiRecon Brand Protection. You can choose from the following options: Active Resolved Ignored
parameters.description: Specify the status to update on Fortinet FortiRecon Brand Protection. You can choose from the following options: Active Resolved Ignored

operations.title: Update Rogue App Status
operations.description: Updates the status of the Rogue App record based on the Rogue App ID and the status to update.

parameters.name: rogue_app_exposure_id
parameters.title: Rogue App ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the rogue app whose status to update on Fortinet FortiRecon Brand Protection.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the rogue app whose status to update on Fortinet FortiRecon Brand Protection.

parameters.title: Status
parameters.name: status

operations.title: Update Social Media Threat Status
operations.description: Updates the status of the Social Media Threat record based on the Social Media Threat ID and the status to update.

parameters.name: social_media_threat_id
parameters.title: Social Media Threat ID
parameters.description: Specify the threat ID of the social media whose status to update on Fortinet FortiRecon Brand Protection.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the threat ID of the social media whose status to update on Fortinet FortiRecon Brand Protection.
